## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install maude_magic in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure maude_magic package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to maude_magic
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/jsm65fenoll/maude-magic):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/jsm65fenoll/maude-magic.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/jsm65fenoll/maude-magic)

``` sh
$ conda install -c jsm65fenoll maude_magic
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/maude-magic/)

``` sh
$ pip install maude_magic
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/jsm65fenoll/maude-magic)’s
[pages](https://jsm65fenoll.github.io/maude-magic/). Additionally you
can find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/jsm65fenoll/maude-magic) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/maude-magic/) respectively.
